author: babkin123
body:
I've noticed that if I have entered a non-Kerberos (i.e. password-based) connection through PowerShell remoting and if while this connection is active the password of this user changes, the connection gets stuck.

On any command including "exit" it prints the error that it had failed to connect due to the denied access but never disconnects.

It should probably provide a way to exit  the connection or just break the connection the first time it gets the access-denied error.
title: the PowerShell remote connection gets stuck if the password gets changed
